label.value: transcript expression location detection by hybridization chain reaction assay

definition.value: An in situ hybridization assay in which the location (e.g. anatomical/tissue) of a transcript is detected by a multiplexed fluorescent in situ hybridization, based on orthogonal amplification with hybridization chain reactions (HCR). RNA probes complementary to mRNA targets trigger chain reactions in which fluorophore-labeled RNA hairpins self-assemble into tethered fluorescent amplification polymers.

A bisulfite sequencing assay that identifies genomic methylation patterns by using a bisulfite based protocol with the Tet enzyme to differentiate 5-hydroxylmethylcytosine (5hmC) from 5-methylcytosine (5mC) through a step-wise oxidative demethylation of 5mC, converting it to 5-carboxylcytosine (5caC) while keeping 5hmC protected.
A contain function that involves physical contact with a specimen. This function is typically performed in such a way that the specimen is usable for an investigation or assay.
A container with the function of containing a specimen.
A container with an environmental control function.
A reverse transcribed polymerase chain reaction that is used to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 5' or 3' end of the mRNA.
A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 5' end of the mRNA.
A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 3' end of the mRNA.

label.value: 5' RNA ligase mediated rapid amplification of cDNA ends

definition.value: A 5' rapid amplification pf cDNA ends that uses RNA ligase to add an RNA adapter oligonucleotide to intact 5' mRNA ends, allowing the amplification of cDNA only from full-length, capped mRNA.

A bisulfite sequencing assay in which a whole-genome sequencing library is prepared, bisulfite converted and amplified, followed by a capture enriching for targeted bisulfite-converted DNA fragments that are are subsequently identified by DNA sequencing.
A material processing that has as its input a specimen and as its output a collection of specimens.

label.value: carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester staining assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells

definition.value: A CFSE assay that detects T cell epitope specific proliferation in vitro.

label.value: assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

definition.value: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the dissociation constant KD.

label.value: assay measuring the on rate [kon] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

definition.value: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the on rate.

label.value: assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

definition.value: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the off rate.

label.value: assay measuring the association constant [KA] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

definition.value: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the association constant KA.

label.value: small-angle scattering assay determining the 3D structure of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A small-angle scattering 3D molecular structure determination assay that characterizes the 3-dimensional molecular structure of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

label.value: bio-layer interferometry assay measuring the on rate [kon] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A bio-layer interferometry assay that measures the on rate of an antigen with an antibody.

label.value: bio-layer interferometry assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A bio-layer interferometry assay that measures the off rate of an antigen with an antibody.

label.value: bio-layer interferometry assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A bio-layer interferometry assay that detects the binding of an antigen with an antibody.

label.value: bio-layer interferometry assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A bio-layer interferometry assay that measures the dissociation constant [KD] of an antigen with an antibody.
An assay using carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester staining.

A binding assay that detects a shift in the interference pattern reflected from a layer of immobilized material on the biosensor tip to measure binding to- or dissociating from the material on the biosensor.

label.value: small-angle scattering 3D molecular structure determination assay

definition.value: A 3D molecular structure determination assay in which the scattering pattern of a neutron or x-ray beam targeted at a material entity is recorded at small angles relative to the incident beam to determine the size, shape and structure of the material entity examined.

label.value: Human 6x630K CGH Whole Genome Tiling Array

definition.value: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Nimblegen corporation to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 6x630,000 features.

A centrally registered identifier symbol used to uniquely identify objects given by International DOI Foundation. The DOI system is particularly used for electronic documents such as journal articles.

label.value: enhanced cross-linking immunoprecipitation high-throughput sequencing assay

definition.value: An iCLIP assay that is enhanced to robustly identify protein-RNA interactions with high efficiency through improvements in library preparation of RNA fragments.
An RNA-seq assay which is targeting small RNA (< 200 bp) sequences such as, but not exclusive to, miRNAs using, for example, small RNA library preparation kits.
An RNA-seq assay to identify spans of nascent transcription in the genome through isolation of recent bromouridine (Bru) labelled RNAs.
An RNA-seq assay to identify RNA populations of specific ages through isolation of RNAs first labelled with bromouridine (Bru) followed by chasing in uridine for different periods of time.

A cytometry assay in which the presence of molecules of interest on or in cells is indicated by binding of antibodies labeled with rare earth element tags which are detected by time-of-flight mass spectrometry.
An analytical chromatography assay that utilizes a high performance liquid chromatography instrument for separation of compounts in a solution.
A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of an entire genome of an organism.
A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of the protein coding components of a genome (exons).
An imaging assay that utilizes a microscope to magnify features of the visualized material of interest that are not visible to naked eye.

A cytometry assay where lymphocytes from two individuals are co-cultured with the lymphocytes from one of the allogeneic individuals (Responders) being labeled (with 3H Thymidine or BrdU) and the proliferation of the labeled cells is measured, which is thought to reflect recognition of histocompatibility antigens on the unlabeled cells (stimulators).

label.value: killer cell immunoglobulin-like receptor typing assay

definition.value: A genotyping assay in which the alleles of genes encoding for killer cell immunoglobulin-like receptors are determined.
A genotyping assay in which the alleles of genes encoding for major histocompatibility complex molecules are determined.
A staining using labeled antibodies, i.e. the analytical part of immunohistochemistry. The staining is applied to fixed specimens on slides to identify biomarkers in tissues.

A staining using hematoxylin and eosin. The staining is applied to fixed specimens on slides to observe the whole structure and morphology of cells in a tissue; nuclei are stained dark blue/purple while cytoplasm is stained pink.
A fixed tissue slide specimen that is the output of H&E slide staining.
A fixed tissue slide specimen that is the output of immunohistochemistry slide staining.
A cell specimen that contains only one cell.
A DNA sequencer manufactured by Solexa as one of its first sequencer lines, launched in 2006, and capable of sequencing 1 gigabase (Gb) of data in a single run.
A DNA sequencer that consists of a set of 10 HiSeq X Sequencing Systems.
An Illumina BeadChip which is an array that interrogates over 4.3 million whole-genome variants for genotyping and copy number variation.
An Illumina methylation BeadChip which is an array that interrogates ~ 850,000 methylation sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.

label.value: pulse stable isotope labeling by amino acids in cell culture

definition.value: An assay that detects differences in protein abundance using samples that have been metabolically labeled in vivo with a stable non-radioactive heavy isotope containing amino acid for a short period of time. After diluting the pulsed cells into growth media without label, high resolution mass spectrometry-based proteomics is used to analyze the time-dependent decay and determine protein stability.

label.value: cytometric bead array assay measuring  epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells

definition.value: A cytometric bead array assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells.

label.value: assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells

definition.value: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells.
